com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook
Class Utility

java.lang.Object
  com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.Utility

public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the methods for various actions to be performed through the facebook API

Author:
optimus

Method Detail

requestUserInfo

public static void requestUserInfo(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner asyncRunner,
                                   FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method calls an asynchronous task to get user information using facebook Graph API.
In this method the asynchronous runner create a facebook request on a separate a thread and the FacebookRequestListener object returns the output of that request back to user. Make a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given string parameters using an HTTP GET (default method).
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler. * Will fetch data from http://graph.facebook.com/me for current authenticated user

Parameters:
asyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application
See Also:
http://developers.facebook.com/docs/api

postToWall

public static void postToWall(Context current,
                              com.facebook.android.Facebook objFb,
                              Bundle params,
                              FacebookDialogListener listener)
This method uses the dialog base facebook request to post a custom feed to the facebook wall.
The elements to be put in the bundle can be checked from (https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/dialogs/feed/).
This method converts the Bundle object into facebook Dialog Base URI and shows it to user in a com.facebook.android.FbDialog.FbDialog object.

Parameters:
current - - context of current activity
objFb - - com.facebook.android.Facebook Object
params - - Bundle object , A sample bundle implementation can be

Bundle params = new Bundle();
params.putString(Constants.PARAMS_FEED_CAPTION, "From Android");
params.putString(Constants.PARAMS_FEED_DESCRIPTION, "Some Message");
params.putString(Constants.PARAMS_FEED_NAME, "Android");
params.putString(Constants.PARAMS_FEED_PICTURE, "http://www.optimusinfo.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/android_developers.png" );
This bundle object will be converted to url using function com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.Utility.encodeUrl
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
See Also:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/dialogs/feed/

deleteWallPost

public static void deleteWallPost(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                                  java.lang.String postId,
                                  FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method deletes the wall post using the facebook post id.
Make a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given HTTP method and string parameters.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
postId - - postId
listener - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application

getPlaces

public static void getPlaces(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                             java.lang.String latitude,
                             java.lang.String longitude,
                             java.lang.String distanceProximity,
                             FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method gives the near by location in the forma of json array.
In this method the asynchronous runner create a facebook request on a separate a thread and the FacebookRequestListener object returns the output of that request back to user.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
latitude - - latitude value in decimals i.e. not a multiple of 1E6
longitude - - longitude value in decimals i.e. not a multiple of 1E6
distanceProximity - - near by distance proximity
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application

checkInLocation

public static void checkInLocation(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                                   java.lang.String placeId,
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   JSONObject coordinates,
                                   FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method checks in a particular location with a place recognizable(place id) by facebook and message.
This method makes a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given HTTP method and string parameters.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
placeId - - placeId returned the facebook API response in com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.Utility.getPlaces call .
message - - custom message
coordinates - - a JSON object with two elements latitude and longitude with their values
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application
See Also:
http://developers.facebook.com/docs/api

uploadPhoto

public static void uploadPhoto(Context current,
                               com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                               Uri photoUri,
                               java.lang.String Caption,
                               FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method uploads a photo to facebook profile. This method compresses the image to a minimum size of 720 pixels if image is larger than this size.
This method makes a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given HTTP method and string parameters.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
current - - context of current running activity
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
photoUri - - Uri of photo selected/captured
Caption - - photo caption
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application
See Also:
http://developers.facebook.com/docs/api

executeFqlQuery

public static void executeFqlQuery(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                                   java.lang.String query,
                                   FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method provides an interface to execute FQL queries.
This method makes a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given HTTP method and string parameters.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
Query - - FQL query string
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application
See Also:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/fql/

executeGraphAPIRequest

public static void executeGraphAPIRequest(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                                          java.lang.String objectId,
                                          java.lang.String metadata,
                                          FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method provides an interface for Graph API calls.
This method works similar to Graph API Explorer (See https://developers.facebook .com/tools/explorer/?method=GET&path=1115266870%3Ffields%3Did%2Cname)
This method makes a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given HTTP method and string parameters.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
Query - - root string / object id
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application
See Also:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/api/, ://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer/?method=GET&path=1115266870 %3Ffields%3Did%2Cname

graphApiSearch

public static void graphApiSearch(com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner mAsyncRunner,
                                  java.lang.String query,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  FacebookRequestListener listener)
This method provides an interface to execute the Search Graph API.
This method works similar to Graph API Explorer (See https://developers.facebook .com/tools/explorer/?method=GET&path=1115266870%3Ffields%3Did%2Cname)
This method makes a request to the Facebook Graph API with the given HTTP method and string parameters.
Note that this method is asynchronous and the callback will be invoked in a background thread; operations that affect the UI will need to be posted to the UI thread or an appropriate handler.

Parameters:
mAsyncRunner - - object of com.facebook.android.AsyncFacebookRunner
query - - query string (For e.g coffee)
type - - query type (for eg place)
listener - - object of com.optimus.mobile.oauth.facebook.FacebookRequestListener
This listener will give the callback result to the application
See Also:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/api/

                             java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String text)
Display a simple alert dialog with the given text and title.

Parameters:
context - - current activity context
title - Alert dialog title
text - Alert dialog message
